content.description:
The question refers to the images shown.

© Yann Arthus-Bertrand / Corbis © De Agostini Picture Library / G. Dagli Orti / The Bridgeman Art Library

The images show an exterior and an interior view of Hagia Sophia.
content.question: Original viewers of the interior of Hagia Sophia were described as reacting with

choices.label: fear at its vulnerability to earthquakes
disgust at its lavish display of opulence
awe that its dome seemingly hovered on a cushion of light
pride that all of its spaces were open to the entire populace

content.answer: awe that its dome seemingly hovered on a cushion of light

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.4: Purpose and Audience in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, function, and/or context of a work of art (or group of related works of art) elicit a response or shape its reception.
